page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF CADEBY
page.content:
Cadeby comprises an interesting blend of old and new property which combines to produce a most attractive effect. The village itself covers an area of approx. 0.15 sq.km. and is surrounded by land devoted to agricultural usage. The majority of its 120 or so residents are not however reliant upon farming for their income and generally commute daily to their place of employment.
No direct bus service is provided into the village but connections to both Hinckley and Leicester are available from the nearby A447 Hinckley-Ashby road. A special school bus service is provided for taking local children to their places of study in either Market Bosworth or Desford.
